page.title: 15Living in Charnwood
page.content: This part of NW Leics lies mostly 150m above sea level and has a small population.There are 100 names on the Electoral Roll and many are over 45yrs old.Families with children are few. They are housed in farmsteads, farm cottages,detached houses.The latter are concentrated at Copt Oak or individual plots in Whitcrofts and Priory Lane.The propeties are self owned or privately rented.{No council {houses.}The building regulations are very strict in this special area which is countryside but not remote.Late land enclosure means straight roads & easy travel to nearby towns.There are{ {No buses}Exit 22 of the M1 Motorway is only 1km SW of Charnwood convenient for distant travel.The Motorway runs NS along the west boundary blending well into the landscape.There is more general upset from gravel lorries.
